p: Due to increased demand for healthier food, natural colorants are widely used in foods and beverages instead of synthetic materials. In addition, natural pigments have been widely used for cosmetic and therapeutic purposes as well [ 86]. Most colorants are extracted from plant tissues that provide a wide range of colors and hues. Natural colorants are extracted from fruit and vegetable sources, such as saffron, berries, annatto, and beetroot [ 57]. Often, consumers prefer processed foods with not only attractive appearance and taste, but also that are healthy. This encourages food industries to search for new solutions and methodologies to meet consumer demand, safety requirements, and possess eco-friendly and biodegradable raw materials [ 87].
